page.title: 06WELWYN HATFIELD
page.content: Welwyn Hatfield District Council is the overriding Local Authority for the District, having been formed on 1st April 1974. It comprises the whole of the former Welwyn Garden City Urban District Council and the former Welwyn and Hatfield Rural District Councils. It is also the designated political constituency for the area and since 1979 has been represented at Westminster by Mr. Christopher Murphy MA MP. The administrative offices of Welwyn/Hatfield are at the Town Hall on the Campus, Welwyn Garden City, which houses the Executive, Financial and Technical Services Departments. The Chief Executive is Mr L Asquith and the population of the District is 94,200 people with 35,255 domestic properties and a rateable value of 19,127,000 pounds.
